item.title: Caution: Superman is poisonous
item.description: According to a McAfee blog post, Superman poses a significant online threat. The company argues that the widespread presence of superheroes beyond comic books allows hackers and scammers to exploit them for cybercrime. McAfee’s survey, which used their SiteAdvisor site ratings, revealed that Superman is the “Most Toxic Superhero.” The study found that searches combining “Superman” with terms like “free torrent download,” “watch,” “free app,” and “online” have a 16.5% chance of leading to websites containing threats like spyware, adware, spam, phishing, viruses, and other malware.

item.title: Robert Walters reports that there is still a high demand for talent in Singapore
item.description: Robert Walters, a recruitment firm, has published its Asia Job Index for the first quarter of 2015, highlighting that finding and hiring local talent remains a top concern in Singapore. The Asia Job Index monitors the number of job postings for professional roles across major job sites and national newspapers in China, Hong Kong, Japan, Malaysia, and Singapore. Toby Fowlston, Managing Director of Robert Walters Southeast Asia, noted that recruitment in Singapore is primarily driven by competition for a limited pool of candidates, making it challenging to attract the most qualified individuals for the right positions.

item.title: Why Such a Stampede to The Cloud?
item.description: The term “cloud” is everywhere you turn. This raises the question: are businesses truly shifting from traditional data centers to cloud-based solutions? And if so, what motivates this transition and what are their objectives? Unveiling the Hidden Potential of Cloud Technology Cloud storage receives significant attention, but the vast server capacity offered by the cloud is equally compelling. One often overlooked application is Hosted PBX or Hosted VoIP, which replaces traditional phone systems.

item.title: Pi Day is on July 22nd
item.description: Pi Day is observed twice a year. The date March 14 (3/14) reflects the constant’s value. It’s also celebrated on July 22, referencing the common fractional representation of Pi, 22/7. To mark the occasion, Parallels has designed an infographic with fascinating information about Pi and suggestions for celebrating.

item.title: The UAE has a strong presence in LinkedIn's list of the top 100 most sought-after employers in EMEA for 2015
item.description: Source: LinkedIn blog. LinkedIn has released its list of the 100 Most In-Demand Employers in Europe, the Middle East, and Africa for 2015. These rankings, showcasing the most sought-after companies in the region, are based on a comprehensive analysis of billions of professional interactions with companies on the LinkedIn platform. Nine companies from the UAE, the only Middle Eastern nation represented, secured a spot on the list. Emirates claimed sixth place, followed by Saudi Aramco (15th), Etihad (20th), Emaar (27th), and Etisalat (30th).

item.title: Lessons for small and medium-sized enterprises from successful viral campaigns
item.description: 4imprint, a company that sells promotional products, has created a new infographic called “Going Viral.” This infographic explains how small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) can learn from viral marketing campaigns. One suggestion is to connect a campaign with something already trending, like a popular TV show or book. This can effectively help a marketing effort gain traction with a specific audience. The infographic also encourages businesses to consider product trials and giveaways.

item.title: The key to e-commerce success according to Akamai
item.description: Akamai, a content delivery network (CDN) provider, emphasizes the importance of speed in e-commerce, stating that slow loading times can lead to customer loss. They suggest two key ways online retailers can improve their businesses: by understanding modern customer behavior and by prioritizing speed, intelligence, and security in their online operations. Mobile shopping is a growing trend. Akamai’s data shows that mobile and tablet shoppers make purchases 20% more often and spend US$500 more than desktop users in the same timeframe, highlighting the need for strong mobile optimization.
